mainBoard.name: Mishra's Factory
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that becomes a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature. Notably, if you turn Mishra's Factory into a creature on the turn it entered the battlefield, you won't be able to then activate its first or last abilities.
After it becomes a creature, Mishra's Factory will still have all its abilities.

mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Each generation teaches the next that artifice is the enemy of natural order."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order
mainBoard.name: Gorilla Shaman
mainBoard.originalText: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.

rulings.text: A tip on how this math works: The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with mana value 0 is {0} + {0} + {1} = {1}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with mana value 1 is {1} + {1} + {1} = {3}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with mana value 2 is {2} + {2} + {1} = {5}. And so on.

mainBoard.text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with mana value X.

mainBoard.flavorText: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan.

mainBoard.originalText: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
mainBoard.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

mainBoard.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to you.

mainBoard.name: Imperial Recruiter
mainBoard.originalText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

mainBoard.text: When Imperial Recruiter enters, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."
—Malga Phlegmtooth
mainBoard.name: Orc General
mainBoard.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:

mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Orcish Cannoneers deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.

mainBoard.flavorText: There's a chance to win every battle.
mainBoard.name: Orcish Captain
mainBoard.originalText: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: You choose the target when you activate the ability. You don’t flip a coin until the ability resolves.

mainBoard.text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Orcish Conscripts
mainBoard.originalText:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.
mainBoard.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

mainBoard.name: Orcish Squatters
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters deals no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: The ability triggers on the declaration of blockers if no blockers are declared for it.
If you lose control of Orcish Squatters before its ability resolves, you won’t gain control of the targeted land at all.

An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Orcish Squatters attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target land defending player controls for as long as you control Orcish Squatters. If you do, Orcish Squatters assigns no combat damage this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.
mainBoard.name: Orcish Veteran
mainBoard.originalText:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.
mainBoard.text:
Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater.
{R}: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: What goes up, must come down.
mainBoard.name: Stone Giant
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at end of turn.

rulings.text: If the Giant’s power and/or toughness change so that its toughness is less than its power, you can have the ability target the Giant itself.

If Stone Giant’s ability is activated during a turn’s end step, the delayed triggered ability won’t trigger until the beginning of the next turn’s end step. The targeted creature will be destroyed at that time.
To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

When the delayed triggered ability resolves, the targeted creature is destroyed, even if it’s no longer a creature, no longer under your control, or no longer has toughness less than Stone Giant’s power at that time.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Every patch of land must belong to Kjeldor, no matter what the cost!"
—General Varchild
mainBoard.name: Varchild's Crusader
mainBoard.originalText: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at end of turn.
mainBoard.text: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at the beginning of the next end step.

mainBoard.name: Skull Catapult
mainBoard.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Death Spark
mainBoard.originalText:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

rulings.text: A card is “directly above” another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later and there are no cards in between the two.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.

Say you’re the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that’s attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma’s Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they’re put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it’s put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it’s put into its owner’s graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

mainBoard.text:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to any target.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"
—Plato, Phædo, trans. Jowett

mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
mainBoard.name: Incinerate
mainBoard.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won’t do anything. The creature can’t be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

mainBoard.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

mainBoard.originalText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
mainBoard.name: Panic
mainBoard.originalText:
Play Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it’s before the beginning of that phase’s Declare Blockers Step.

mainBoard.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
mainBoard.name: Pyrokinesis
mainBoard.originalText:
You may remove a red card in your hand from the game rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn’t resolve.

mainBoard.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
mainBoard.name: Pillage
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Eenie, meenie, minie, moe . . . oh, why not all of them?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
mainBoard.name: Meteor Shower
mainBoard.originalText: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: You can’t choose to do fractional damage to a target.

A tip on how this math works: To deal a total of 1 damage, X is 0. The cost is {0} + {0} + {R} = {R}. To deal a total of 2 damage, X is 1. The cost is {1} + {1} + {R} = {2}{R}. To deal a total of 3 damage, X is 2. The cost is {2} + {2} + {R} = {4}{R}. And so on.
You divide the damage as you cast Meteor Shower, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

mainBoard.text: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
